titleStmt.title: Advanced use of ODD : workshop proposal
titleStmt.author: Lou Burnard Consulting

revisionDesc.change: Revised after initial comments from Mutec

div.head: Workshop objectives
div.p: ODD ("One Document Does it all") is an XML documentation system in the literate programming paradigm which was originally designed as a means of expressing customizations of the TEI. Its current version, however, goes beyond this to provide a generic tool for the documentation and management of any XML encoding scheme, not necessarily one based on the TEI, although it is most often used in that context.

A major difficulty for TEI novices has always been how to select amongst the hundreds of elements and attributes defined within it. An ODD provides a well defined way of declaring that selection once it has been made, ut the procedure of defining an ODD remains mystwerious for many, despite the existence of tools suchj as Roma which provide a simpler intereface.
In this workshop we hope to shed light on these mysteries. More concretely, participants will gain:

list.item: a detailed practical knowledge of the whole of the currently defined ODD system
an understanding of the various ways in which it may be used to customise the TEI (séléction and modification of components, addition of new components)
an understanding of the formal TEI specifications for elements, macros, and classes, together with their use in the construction of the TEI schema
hands on experience in the creation and develpment of TEI schemas adapted to the needs of specific projects dealing with a variety of primary materials
experience in the use of currently available ODD processing tools

div.p: The Workshop will be of most use to people whose role includes training non-technically-oriented staff on the best use of ODD, or otherwise providing technical support to the TEI community.

Amongst other topics we intend to cover the following:
going beyond Roma: how to use ODD for documentation;
using Schematron to implement additional constraints
how to chain ODDs together
using "ODD by example" to generate an ODD; comparison between this and a project defined ODD
conversion between exclusive and inclusive style ODDs; implications of the choice
concepts, implementation, and implications of "Pure ODD"

div.head: Practical details
div.p: The workshop will run for a full day, and will consist of a mixture of discussion, formal presentations, and hands-on practical work. For the latter, participants will be expected to provide their own laptops (unless a training room with workstations is available). Although any XML-editor may be used, the materials we prepare will assume that an up to date installation of oXyGen is available on each participant's machine.

list.label: public
list.item: No more than 10-15 participants will be accepted. They should have some knowledge of the basics of TEI and of XML. General IT skills (for example, file management, how to use an editor etc.) are assumed.
list.label: trainers

The workshop will be run by Lou Burnard and Sebastian Rahtz

Discussion de l'usage actuel de ODD dans les projets de participants: ils souhaitent traîter quels types de document et en quelles manières? quels problèmes rencontrés, quels opérations d'amélioration, de maintenance ou de contrôle ils souhaiteraient mener?
Initiation au format ODD : syntaxe des spécifications ; exercice simple de création d'un ODD non-TEI élémentaire ; concept de "Pure ODD".
Rappel de l'organisation et du contenu de la TEI :

Cas d'étude : construction d'un ODD pour le balisage des cartes postales avec Roma ; puis génération d'un ODD à partir d'un corpus de documents existants : comparaison et discussion des deux méthodes.

ODD "under the hood" : présentation of TEI P5 source code. explication de fonctionnement de quelques personnalisations ; usage de moduleRef ; ODD par inclusion ou exclusion : implications techniques et mode de conversion.
Gestion, validation et traitement d'un ODD avec Oxygen et d'autres outils. Principes de conformité. Niveau de formalisation nécessaire dans la chaîne de pérennisation CINES-TGIR Huma-num
